data.title: Liberty Hall Museum
data.meta_description: There is something for everyone at The Museum, Arboretum, and Gardens at Liberty Hall, one of New Jersey’s premier historic destinations.
data.text:
Plan Your Visit

Discover a treasure trove of American history at The Museum at Liberty Hall!

Come and explore a revolutionary-era home that grew into a 50-room mansion, and trace one family’s history through furnishings, decorative arts, clothing, and so much more. Take a guided tour with one of our knowledgeable museum educators and hear the fascinating stories and legends that make Liberty Hall one of New Jersey’s most treasured historic homes. Explore the exquisite arboretum and gardens highlighting an artistic array of historical horticulture, including some of New Jersey’s oldest trees.

Please note the walkways on the Liberty Hall property are gravel and the mansion is not ADA-compliant. Thanks to a grant from the NJ Historic Trust we are currently working towards making the mansion ADA-compliant.

The Museum at Liberty Hall is part of the Passport To Your National Parks program. Bring your passport when you visit and make sure to get it stamped!

There is something for everyone at The Museum, Arboretum, and Gardens at Liberty Hall, one of New Jersey’s premier historic destinations.

For more information on tours and tour availability, please visit the tours page.
